physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Initially, no dysmorphic features and the remainder of the physical examination was unremarkable. Skeletal survey showed diffuse osteopenia with coarse trabecular changes of the long bones and thinning of the diaphyseal cortices but no fractures.
Weight dropped to 1850 g (less than the third percentile). Persistent hypercalcemia was noted with high PTH levels (563 pg/ml), low serum albumin (2.4 g/dl), and undetectable urine calcium.
By this time, the infant was clinically stable without respiratory distress, but urine calcium remained undetectable.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Progressed to a normal serum calcium level maintained through cinacalcet treatment.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Recurrence of hyperparathyroidism following a short trial off cinacalcet.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Recurrence of hyperparathyroidism and exacerbation of hypercalcemia noted.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Total alkaline phosphatase slightly above normal [316 IU/liter (80–270)]; bone-specific alkaline phosphatase at 17 months was normal [111 g/liter (25–124)].
Repeat skeletal survey showed greatly decreased osteopenia with no fractures or architectural abnormalities detected, though metaphyseal sclerosis of long bones was noted.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Osteopenia showed improvement with no fractures noted.
